TopicTitle: Finding KSP In All The Strange Places

Articles.Content: I was looking for some pictures of hardware when I stumbled across this space fan site... KSP Link on ProjectRho ... and what did he start rattling on about... KSP of course. It's a relatively nice site with some info for our younger Kerbonauts but still puts over some stuff for older peeps as well. Sooooooo.... big question is "Where is the strangest place you have found KSP info on your interweb travels?" Oh and excuse the poorly formatted post... THE FORUM HAS GONE GAGA AGAIN! grrrr...
The guy that runs ProjectRho is a poster on these forums....

Didn't know that Goddess. I kind of like the simplicity of ProjectRho... Makes me think of the classic boys scifi... Anyone remember Tom Swift? Oh and the reason I ended up there was that I was looking for pictures of the translation control handle... and ended up thinking "This is perfect for teaching newbies what translation control actually is."

Edited September 7, 2013 by NeoMorph
Bookmarked. For the purposes of the old-timey artwork stashed there. The next couple whackjob crafts might be inspired by these.

Bookmarked. For the purposes of the old-timey artwork stashed there. The next couple whackjob crafts might be inspired by these.

That site has eaten up many hours of my reading time. I especially appreciate the section regarding alien species and am trying to find a copy of "The Killing Star".

The guy that runs ProjectRho is a poster on these forums....

You can find him and his amazing atomic pulse mod here...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/28428-Orion-aka-Ol-Boom-boom

I too have spent hours at his sites. Its actually nyrath that got me into KSP. I'd seen trailers and I thought that the green guys were indicative of a game that I wouldn't want, so I never looked into it further. I follow his Tweets sometimes and he tweeted that it was on sale at Steam and that the science is well done. So I bought it and found out that it was completely different from the silly game I had imagined it to be. Now I can't imagine the game without the Kerbals. :-O

@ecat: yeah, the Orion mod is really good. It can kick you right out of the Kerbol system too.

I've seen KSP on the Imgur front page a couple times. It's rare, but it's a pleasant sight when it happens. I thought it was really cool with a small group of people cosplayed Bill, Jeb and Bob at a convention (PAX I think).

Here it is: http://imgur.com/gallery/XBryUCr

I doubt they'd mind a hotlink.

#EDIT: Ok, my links ain't working. Can't post it.

Edited September 7, 2013 by Whackjob

Well, some time ago, I was watching some news from spain. They were talking about a new chinese (IIRC) supercomputer, which would revolutionize simulations for new aircraft designs.

As the news reporter talked, they showed some of Scott Manley's second B9 review video.

Well, some time ago, I was watching some news from spain. They were talking about a new chinese (IIRC) supercomputer, which would revolutionize simulations for new aircraft designs.

As the news reporter talked, they showed some of Scott Manley's second B9 review video.

One word, Laughing out loud and rolling of the floor
